snippet: With high unemployment in California, environmentalists and politicians see the need to overhaul the state’s landmark environmental law, which can delay even green projects.
abstract: Environmentalists and politicians see the need to overhaul California's landmark environmental law, which has opened the door to lawsuits that can delay even green projects; high unemployment has turned the law into a test in the struggle to balance environmental concerns against the need for jobs and economic growth.
lead_paragraph: With high unemployment in California, environmentalists and politicians see the need to overhaul the state’s landmark environmental law, which can delay even green projects.

headline.seo: To Add Jobs, Many in California Look to Alter Green Law
headline.main: Critics Say California Law Hurts Effort to Add Jobs
headline.print_headline: Critics Say A State Law Hurts Effort To Add Jobs
